item.title: Compiling Statically With Glibc Raises Segfault at Runtime
item.description: Iâ€™m writing a chatting bot with Haskell and I need to statically compile my program, run it on the server which is running on Ubuntu 18.04 bionic. When I built my stack project with GHC option -optl-static, running it, I got a segfault. Checking the core dump file and I got this: Stack trace of thread 26051: #0 0x00007f5ce4cef448 n/a (/lib/x86\_64-linux-gnu/libnss\_files-2.27.so) #1 0x00007f5ce4cf08bd \_nss\_files\_gethostbyname4\_r (/lib/x86\_64-linux-gnu/libnss\_files-2.27.so) #2 0x0000000001a41d66 n/a (/home/nutr1t07/wl) #3 0x0000000001a42c39 n/a (/home/nutr1t07/wl) #4 0x0000000000ddcf91 n/a (/home/nutr1t07/wl) I ran the same program on my PC, it raised a segfault as well.
